intro: Agalmyla similis, commonly known as the common agalmyla, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It is a perennial herb with slender, upright stems and small, lance-shaped leaves. The plant produces clusters of delicate, white to pale pink flowers that bloom in early summer. Agalmyla similis is adapted to well-drained soils and full sun, making it a hardy plant in Mediterranean climates. It is often found in open woodlands and rocky areas, where it thrives in dry conditions.
